noun.description: A member of a Sioux people formerly living along the Missouri River in eastern Nebraska and now in Oklahoma, where they are one component of the people formally known as the Otoe-Missouria Tribe.
The Siouan Chiwere language of this people.

adjective.description: Of or designating the Otoe people or their language.

origin: Mid 18th century. From French Oto, shortened from Otoctatas, via Illinois from an unrecorded form in Oto matching Osage Wadochtáta and other cognates; compare later Oto watótta.
